Previous Next

We are a team of researchers under the direction of Professor Jonathan Goodall exploring new ways to bring advancements in computing and data science to societyâ€™s most challenging water resources management problems.

Our group is housed within the interdisciplinary Link Lab, a 17,000 square foot laboratory in the Engineering School at the University of Virginia that brings together faculty and students with a shared interest in cyber-physical systems. If you are interested in joining our group, please check out our openings.

In addition to the publications, general research interests, and example projects on this site, we also maintain a Github organization where much of the the code resulting from our research is released free and open source.

Latest News

July 31, 2019

We are excited to welcome two new PhD students to the group. Natalie Lerma joins us from Texas A&M and Jake Nelson from industry after earning an MS from BYU.

July 20, 2019

Congrats to Gina O'Neil for defending her dissertation! She and has accepted a job at ESRI.

June 30, 2019

Jeff will be joining USGS as a Mendenhall Fellow! He will be part of the USGS Office of Water Information (OWI) Data Science team

May 1, 2019

We are excited to have two undergraduate students, Clifford and Emily, and one undergraduate student, Naomi, join us this summer for research.
